note.value: This Christian Palestinian Aramaic version of 2 Kings (2 Samuel) 22:3b-19a; 3 Kings (1 Kings) 2:35b-35o is one of the oldest attested Vatican Septuagint text witnesses

Bibliography: P. de Lagarde, Librorum Vetis Testamenti Canonicorum pars prior graece (Göttingen, 1883), p. 239 ; Gibson, Catalogue of the Arabic Manuscripts in the Convent of S. Catharine on Mount Sinai (Cambridge University Press, 1894), p. 125 ; J. F. Stenning apud G. H. Gwilliam, F. C. Burkitt, and J. F. Stenning, Biblical and Patristic Relics of the Palestinian Syriac Literature from MSS. in the Bodleian Library and in the Library of Saint Catherine on Mount Sinai, Anecdota Oxoniensia 1:9 (Oxford, 1896), p. 31-34 ; A. Rahlfs, Septuaginta-Studien, I-III (Göttingen, 1965), p. 370-655 ; N. Fernández Marcos and J. R. Busto-Saiz, El texto antioqueno de la Biblia Griega. Vol. 2, 1-2 Reyes (Madrid, 1992) ; Gibson, p. 125 ; Gwilliam, Burkitt, and Stenning, pp. 31-34
